newsitem.title: UK: Smet buys Perishables Transport from Sommer Holdin.
newsitem.headline: Smet buys Perishables Transport from Sommer Holdin.

text.p: Perishables Transport Company(PTC) has been bought from Sommer Holdings by German industrialist Franz Smet, the latter said in a statement.

The transaction covers PTC's airfreight and roadfreight facilities, staff and business, while Sommer Holdings will absorb PTC's smaller ocean operation into its WTA general freight forwarding company, the statement added.
The value of the transaction was not disclosed.
PTC employs 60 staff at its Heathrow and Gatwick centres. The Heathrow centre compromises a 24,000 sq ft facility including rapid blast chillers and storage for 300 pallets in nine temperature zones.

It said PTC offers a full range of perishables transport services including customs clearance, import breakbulk, storage and chilled distribution utilising a large, modern fleet of refrigerated air-ride vehicles. It operates regular inbound refrigerated road services from Europe, and also provides quality control monitoring of inbound produce.

Smet said:"There is an investment programme already in place which will see the installation of state-of the-art rapid blast chillers within weeks. This programme will not only be maintained. but stepped up. We have bought PTC to develop it."

In 1994, Smet bought another perishables traffic specialist, Unifresh. The statement said it is planned to exploit synergies between the two companies, but there is no immediate plan to amalgamate their operations. - Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax:5017
